metadata.title: CVE-2014-9911 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the ures_getByKeyWithFallback function in common/uresbund.cpp in International Components for Unicode (ICU) before 54.1 for C/C++ allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted uloc_getDisplayName call.

notes.note: jdstrand> this was fixed in 54.0.1. chromium-browser has 56 now chrisccoulson> firefox has 56 at least since Firefox 50, and Thunderbird has 56 since at least 45.3 oxide has had 56.1 since at least 1.17

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu4').
